	System.out.println("You Win");
}
else{

item.title: Little Java Problem
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“lawl, post:1, topic:164569”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=223127.msg1927466#msg1927466 date=1197520191]
I don’t know exactly what the error is, but those statements can easily be simplified as follows:

if (us3 == 21 || us3 == cp3) {
	System.out.println("You Loose");
} else {
	System.out.println("You Win");
}

[/quote]
uhh, no, cause in blackjack, you dont automatically win when your count is < 21[/quote]

Lol, good point.

Read full topic

item.title: Little Java Problem
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

Or, to simplify even more (just for the fun of it), this could be done:

System.out.println(us3 == 21 || us3 == cp3 ? "You win!" : "You lose!");

However, it is nothing you really have to do… It is all up to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Little Java Problem
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

the error in lets say :

			if (us3 > 21)
			{
				if (us3 > cp3)
				{
					System.out.println("You Lose");
				}
			}

is that if us3 is < 21 but us3 is > cp3 it will not print anything out and exit

Read full topic

item.title: Little Java Problem
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

			if (us3 > 21)
			{
				if (us3 > cp3)
				{
					System.out.println("You Lose");
				}
			}
			else if (us3 < 21)
			{
				if (us3 < cp3)
				{
					System.out.println("You Lose");
				}
			}
			else {
				System.out.println("You win");
			}

I don’t know exactly what the error is, but those statements can easily be simplified as follows:

if (us3 == 21 || us3 == cp3) {
	System.out.println("You Loose");
} else {
	System.out.println("You Win");
}

Read full topic

item.title: Little Java Problem
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

it seems like it does not go through the ifs because :

in the first if :

			if (us3 > 21)
			{
				if (us3 > cp3)
				{
					System.out.println("You Lose");
				}
			}

if us3 < cp3 it will not say anything and same with the second if, this can be fixed by puting else after the 2 ifs like so :

			if (us3 > 21)
			{
				if (us3 > cp3)
				{
					System.out.println("You Lose");
				}
				else
				{
					System.out.println("You win?");
				}
			}

Read full topic

item.title: Little Java Problem
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

I’m trying to make a really simple game like blackjack, but my if statements are never triggering 

import java.util.*;

public class firstgame
 {
		public static void main (String[] args)
		{
  			// test2 = generator.nextInt(13) + 1;
			// test = input.next();

			int us1, us2, us3, cp1, cp2, cp3;
			String yn;

			Random generator = new Random();
			Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);

			System.out.println("Benneth \\ My First Game: Blackjack");

			us1 = generator.nextInt(13) + 1;
			System.out.println("\n\nYou draw a " + us1);

			cp1 = generator.nextInt(13) + 1;
			System.out.println("\n\nComputer draws a " + cp1);

			us2 = generator.nextInt(13) + 1;
			System.out.println("\n\nYou draw a " + us2);

			cp2 = generator.nextInt(13) + 1;
			System.out.println("\n\nComputer draws a " + cp2);

			us3 = us1 + us2;
			cp3 = cp1 + cp2;

			if (us3 > 21)
			{
				if (us3 > cp3)
				{
					System.out.println("You Lose");
				}
			}
			else if (us3 < 21)
			{
				if (us3 < cp3)
				{
					System.out.println("You Lose");
				}
			}
			else {
				System.out.println("You win");
			}


}
}

please help me

Read full topic
